data.title: Longstanding Intellisense bug
data.body:
Will somebody please give this bug some attention?  There are many of us that haven't been able to move from version 0.10.3 in December.  I would very much like to run an up to date version of VSCode.

https://github.com/OmniSharp/omnisharp-roslyn/issues/371
https://github.com/OmniSharp/omnisharp-vscode/issues/6

data.title: automatic list dependent modules
data.body:
This PR will be helpful for build automation.
1.  see #4265. Import an dependent module need open`build/gulpfile.vscode.js` and change var `baseModules`. Now `baseModules` is automatic extracting. 
2. `packageTask` no longer has a dependency on `npm-shrinkwrap.json`.

data.title: VSTS extension errors on check-in policies
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Alt-T in VSTS TFS extension
2. CheckIn
3. Add comment on file where check-in policies are required
4. CheckIn attempted, non-descript error reported

If there are options to specify a linked Work Item or an Override Warning, these are not shown or documented.
![error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8682930/14922376/3cd1c90a-0e05-11e6-8243-458f3b43b12c.PNG)

data.title: VSTS Add and CheckIn options have same description for TFS
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Alt-T for TFS VSTS extension menu
2. "Add" and "CheckIn" menu items have same description (seems unintentional)
   ![vsts menu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8682930/14922264/a519842c-0e04-11e6-95e5-9f7719be1bea.png)

data.title: Quite often when opening VS Code my display driver crashes
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 10586.218

Steps to Reproduce: 
It happens sporadically so I'm afraid I can't give steps that will always make it happen. However it happens probably once a day, and doesn't matter if I just open it normally or use open with VS Code in File Explorer. If I close Code and open it again then it just works.

All my monitors flash black and after about a second or two I get a Windows notification that My AMD display driver stopped responding and recovered.

Just a few days ago I noticed an AMD Driver update came through Windows update, but that didn't make it any better.

I'm not sure if its a VS Code problem or a driver problem, any guidance would be appreciated.

data.title: Make it possible to confirm/apply popup action using keyboard

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Currently popup messages could be only dismissed using keyboard. I would be good to have a way to apply affirmative action using keyboard as well.

![popup-warn](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/351671/14917822/881a13c6-0e29-11e6-825f-817920dfb627.png)

Besides, from UX point of view 'Close' label could be misleading, as it is not always obvious that will be closed. Consider changing to 'Cancel'.

data.title: Codeblocks stopped formatting and highlighting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. start a code block with `csharp
2. enter code
3. end code block with`
Although they all seem to work here...

Before updating to version 1.0 code blocks would highlight in md and the preview; not after
when enter { } automatic indenting and formatting would occur; not after the update

Example:
There is no coloring or formatting in this codeblock...
Comments also don't show green like they did before

``` csharp
public string LastName { get; set; }
public string FirstName { get; set; }

public string FullName
{
get { return FirstName + " " + LastName; }
}
```

data.title: [json] accept empty keybindings.json file
data.body: When the `keybindings.json` is empty an error shows that it needs to be at least an empty array. I think we can be more graceful and allow an empty file as well.

data.title: VS Code writes the log to FAR Manager panel
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run Far Manager (www.farmanager.com)
2. Run VS Code.

You'll see VS Code logs in the Far Manager console they just fill the panels making impossible to work until you reload panels.
![snap 2016-04-29 at 14 00 14](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/107505/14909196/3845aefc-0e13-11e6-868d-241882612438.png)

data.title: Git: Symlink support

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0 (1.0.0)
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.4 (15E65)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new project with git repository initialised.
2. Create a folder /foo/bar
3. Add a symlink from /foo/bar to /bar `ln -s /foo/bar .`
4. Go to **Git** tab on vscode, and stage `/bar` folder.

If now you click on staged `/bar` folder, you'll get an error `Warn: Can't open this git resource.`

data.title: debug - additional steps should not be sent until previous step has completed
[less] syntax failure when identifier starts with a number
Ctrl+/ to create comment when cursor is at the beginning of the line puts the cursor in a strange position
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Win 10 (10586.218)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a JS or C++ file, probably others that use // as the comment token (make sure the appropriate syntax mode is in the bottom right)
2. Place cursor at the beginning of a line (Col 1)
3. Press Ctrl+/
4. Observe that the cursor is now at Col 7 (not the same place in the previous text)

Desired behavior case:
1. same as above
2. Place cursor at any column besides Col 1 (e.g. Col 2)
3. Press Ctrl+/
4. Observe that the cursor is moved 3 columns to the right (the length of the inserted comment token and space `'// '`), and that the cursor is at the same position in the text of the line as it was before pressing the hotkey.

The desired behavior case written above is a much better experience because the code author can better predict where his cursor will be after pressing the hotkey.

Edit: the file I'm editing has CRLF line endings, in case that makes a difference.
